description: Sammy's may be a liquor store but this place has awesome deli style sandwiches.  I go here pretty often, just got a free sandwich for my 10th purchase.  The guy behind the counter making the sandwiches is all business but he makes a mean one.  If you like your sandwiches with a little kick ask him to spicen it up for you.  I have no idea what he puts in them but it definitely adds to the flavor.
author: Ayaz M.

description: A very affordable sandwich shop with a nice and friendly staff.  Their frequent buyer program is easy, and I love their soups.
author: Kris A.

description:
this afternoon, being a friday, my co-worker and i decided we needed a little happy hour in the office.  we admired the beer selection and settled on hoegaarden.  however, hoegaarden requires a lemon.  which they had.  and sliced it up for us!  then we realize, hoegaarden requires a bottle opener.  which they had.  right next to the condoms.  is there anything this place doesn't have?

next time i will have to go for a sandwich...
author: Erin G.

description: Some colleagues and I ventured a bit further from our usual 3-block radius to go to Sammy's for lunch. I got the veggie sandwich on Dutch crunch, along with the soup of the day. With better bread, it would easily be 4 stars, but none of us actually liked the bread that much - maybe it was just today's batch, but it was extremely chewy, unlike any Dutch crunch I've had before. The rest of the sandwich (construction + choice of cheeses/veggies) and the soup was quite good for the price. We'll probably try it again at some point, but this first visit didn't get us hooked.
author: Vinay B.

description: Sort of expensive for what you get and really slow. I ordered the house special and it sounded good but then made no sense. The pita bread it was in was dry and way over stuffed so it fell apart in my hand. And to add to that the mustard was just drippy. Overall I was not pleased
author: Greg G.

description:
Maybe my expectations were set too high by the other reviews here but I didn't see anything special about this place. I ordered (I think it was called) the middle eastern plate and it was pretty alright but forgettable.

They definitely have price going for them though. In an area of town where it's hard to get lunch for less than $12 you can get by on $5.
author: kavin s.

description:
Totally agree with everything that's been said thus far.  Surprisingly good sandwiches.  Very clean.  Staff is very nice.  I eat here a few times a week.

If you're looking for an excellent, fresh sandwich, I can't recommend Sammy's highly enough.
author: K F.

description: I love coming here!  Everyone who works here is so nice and friendly.  They are truly a hole in the wall/mom and pop sandwich and convenience store.  They have all kinds of snacks including chips, candy, ICE CREAM and a wide variety of ALCOHOL and nonalcoholic beverages.  But the main reason I come here is for their sandwiches.  I can't really stomach Subway anymore because their ingredients don't taste as fresh.  Sammy's has all fresh veggies and they get their bread delivered every day.  They also offer awesome combo meals for less than $10.  They have a deli type area where they sell empanadas, Pierogis, tuna salad or chicken salad, and different pasta salads.  If you loooove sandwiches, I would definitely recommend coming here.
author: Leah A.

description:
Today was the second time in one week that I found myself at Sammy's buying copius amounts of alcohol before 9:30 in the morning.  The guys working behind the counter just give me the once over, shake their heads a little and charge me for the bottles.  

Sammys is a small place, but they always have what I need.
author: Tamar N.

description: The sandwich was okay I guess, but the guy was talking on a bluetooth or something the whole time which was kind of rude.
author: Grant M.

description: I am lazy and often short on time, and this is across the street from my work, and serves their purpose well and efficiently.  They have a great deli which makes wonderful sandwiches made to order, plus your typical mini-mart convenience for beverages and chips/snacks.  Friendly staff, clean atmosphere, frequent buyer card....all around awesome new spot!
author: Christina T.

description:
Love Sammy's! 

They are always so friendly and take the time to recognize regular customers and their usual orders! They do a great job making a quick real deli sandwich that tastes delicious. 

Also they have a frequent buyer card so every 10th sandwich is free!
author: Michelle D.

description: Not very tasty. Poor quality products. Stale and chewy bread.
author: C L.

description: Wonderful little sandwich shop.  Lots of meat options, including some great mortadella.  Won't break the bank, everything is fresh, and service is fast.  Will definitely be coming here again.  There's no seating, and the parking meters on 2nd(or Jessie) are super-thirsty, but it'd be a great place to prepare for a picnic... just pick up a couple of sandwiches, a bottle of wine, and head to dolores park/stern grove!
author: Mike R.

description: The store is very clean & tidy. But the Falafel sandwich was very unpleasant to eat because the way it was constructed the pita was split in half. The ingredients spread so when you bite into it stuff went all over the place not fun!  They  specialize in mediterranean food and can not get a Falafel right.
author: BE L.

description: The sandwiches were great and the Middle Eastern fare above average. I was disappointed there was only one soup selection (Vegetarian Vegetable).
author: Karen R.

description: This place has some good vegetarian options and bagels for the morning. They also have a card that will get you a free 10th sandwich. Its not too expensive and i recommend trying it.
author: Tim R.

description: Not sure why a small hole in the wall store has the BEST sandwich's ever! But the food is great and workers are very nice!
author: Cathy N.

description: I've been to Sammy's twice so far. The first time I went to Sammy's, I got to talk to Sammy for about 15 minutes, we had a great conversation about Palestinian/Israel relations, as he is Palestinian and I'm Israeli, so we are making peace over food, awesome! I asked him for a recommendation for a something to eat and he said that I should order the sandwich that he makes for himself, which is a chicken breast sandwich with onions and other good stuff. I've gotten his sandwich twice so far and it is really tasty. Looking forward to going back!
author: Shai G.

description: Sandwiches here are solid. Just the usual, bread, meat, cheese, lettuce (romaine!) tomato, pickle, pepper, mayo and mustard, but it's really good.  All for $5-$6.  And for a small dirty looking place, its very clean inside.
author: Wakako U.

description: I'm psyched that Sammy's has moved even CLOSER to my office so I can get my Dietz & Watson Roast Beef fix.  Everyone's friendly in here.  I think the secret's out!!
author: Tony T.

description: Excellent lunch deal in Union Square.  The turkey sandwich that I ordered was piled high with turkey...and they have 2 varieties of mustard....and red onions...and a nice variety of cheese for such a small place.  Quite true that you aren't getting ambiance, but for $5 a more than enough sandwich who cares?  Sammy's father-in-law rang me up, and seeing his mid-day smile had a positive effect on my boring afternoon!
author: Amy Z.

description: Tasty, fast and cheap, the egg salad was really good, but the whole wheat bread a little bit dry, perhaps because it was late in the day. Good drink selection. The service was fast and straightforward. Definitely worth the $5!
author: Alison M.

description: Reasonably priced sandos found here. Staff is very friendly. Buy 9 sandos, get the 10th gratis!
author: Maureen P.

description: I love Sammy's, it is my favorite place to get a sandwich.   Everyone is extremely friendly and you can't beat the price.  They also have an excellent beverage selection.
author: Jenny R.

description: Love Sammys - I can get a great lunch for around $5.  Sammy always has great music playing and he and everyone is always friendly.  Great sandwiches, and wonderful soup.
author: Dorian P.

description: Best salami sandwich in SF (aside from Molinari's).  Great rolls, German potato salad used to be the best but they discontinued it..  Sammy won't let you down.
author: andy r.

description: what a find! and thanks Dor for taking me here.  From the financial district, only a couple blocks, and a great sandwich for about $5.  Everyone really great.   Never a crowd, quick in and out. Better than all the local alternatives...
author: Steve G.

description: Great place to get that lunch time sandwich and not break your pocketbook. Sammy, the owner is always warm and welcoming! Forget 7/11 and go for the quality!
author: Maggie M.

description: I had the Roast beef: Decent sandwich- not bad, but didn't blow me away either.  It's good to find little sandwich places near Union Square for a quick meal, but  I would not go out of my way for this...
author: Will B.

description: Great sandwiches, and one of the few sandwich places open (relatively) late near the Financial District.
author: Gregory K.

description: Great New York style deli.  Sandwiches are always fresh and made to order at a reasonable price.  I had been eyeing the ravioli and decided to get it...BAD choice.  If I wasn't mistaken, it tastes just like Chef Boyardee...really guys?
author: Bryan H.

description: kinda on the pricey side, but it is really convenient and open late.
author: Shawn A.

description: I probably go here 3 times a week.  I get the hummus sandwich on sourdough and it's just delicious!  It comes with hummus, lettuce tomatoes onions pickles and... jalapenos!!!  The old man (i'm guessing sammy himself) is really nice but I took one star off because the younger guy who works there doesn't always listen and i end up not having hummus..
author: Caleb D.

description: Agreed!  The meal deal is a huge sandwich, chips and a drink for $7.55 including tax.  You can't get that anywhere around here...  And it's DELICIOUS!
author: Leslie R.

description: this is a great place to grab a sandwich during your lunch break.  the old man might look like he could beat you up with his eyebrows, but he's really the nicest sandwich maker i've met and he seems very delighted that you're eating his sandwiches.  i've tried the roast beef and the chicken salad, and both were very good.  make sure to pick up the sandwich card (buy 9 get 1 free)!
author: Jon Y.

description: I'm a huge sandwich fan and this is definitely one of the better sandwich spots I've been to here in the financial district. There was a ton of meat and fresh bread. Only downside was that they didn't have any soups today but its probably b/c its 12/31 and nobody is working today. Otherwise I will definitely be back again!
author: Deepak G.

description: Most average sandwich I've ever had in the city. Would not recommend. On top of having a pretty lousy sandwich, there was no soup for the lunch sandwich special. If you're in the area, I'd recommend Cafe Verde over this place any day
author: Jeremia K.

description: this used to be the lunch spot everyday a  few years ago when i worked around there. the sandwiches are huge! get to know them and show them love(tipping, bullshitting with them) they might even give you a frequent buyer discount. don't be afraid to hit up the stuff in the cooler.
author: Ausewaldoe J.
